title: thunderbird - no encuentro el calendario
content:
Hola ! 

se actualizo el Thunderbird y me desaparecio el calendario . Donde lo almacena ? o como puedo hacer para encontrarlo ?

primero me aparecio la leyenda que no tenia ningun calendario activo. intente buscarlo y agregarlo pero no tuve suerte. 

para probar ... cree un calendario nuevo y despues me puse a buscarlo ... y tampoco encuentro donde lo guarda .  espero puedan ayudarme . gracias !
creator: palavecinorm

title: Reminder sound file doesn't work
content:
I want to change the reminder sound. I already downloaded a MP3 file and I selected it on "Reminders", "Use the following sound file". I can see the window that pops up, but no sound is played. Also when I click on Play, it doesn't work. I know the sound file is fine, thus I can play it on my laptop. What should I do? Another question, is there any Add-on with Reminder sounds?

Thanks in advance.
creator: lalos999

title: Transfering Email
content: I currently have a Outlook account and a Jagwireless email account. I am trying to move it to Thunderbird. I can now receive my Jagwireless Emails in Thunderbird but I can not send emails through Thunderbird. Any ideas how to fix this?
creator: david120167

title: Authentication failure with SMTP-server
content:
I've been running Thunderbird for years on Gentoo which has version 115.10.1 as the most recent. I don't send much mail so I'm not exactly sure when this problem occurred, but I'm unable to authenticate with my SMTP server. I have not changed any configuration. Some weeks ago a changed my password on the server, but I made the appropriate changes to Thunderbird password manager. All settings, username and passwords are 100% correct as I copy pasted all of them. IMAP on the same server (uses same credentials) works.

I have tried deleting and re-adding my accounts which did not help. I have also tried deleting my profile folder. All other mail clients (e.g. claws-mail, kmail, mailspring) with the same SMTP server don't have any problems sending mail. This problem seems to only affect Thunderbird and Thunderbird forks such as Betterbird.

I have no firewall and am using SSL authentication with cleartext password on the SMTP server.

I get the following output to console on attempted sending of message:

console.error: (new Error("Server error 503 Service Unavailable", "resource://services-settings/Utils.sys.mjs", 390)) console.error: mailnews.smtp: "Command failed: 535 Incorrect authentication data; currentAction=_actionAUTHComplete" console.error: mailnews.smtp: "Authentication failed: Incorrect authentication data" console.error: mailnews.smtp: "Authentication failed: Incorrect authentication data" console.error: mailnews.send: "Sending failed; Unable to authenticate to Outgoing server (SMTP) mail.kapsi.fi. Please check the password and verify the 'Authentication method' in 'Account Settings | Outgoing server (SMTP)'., exitCode=2153066805, originalMsgURI="
creator: kompak1

title: Thunderbird Calendar - Reminders need to be closed via Window-Button
content: Since last update, Reminders pop up window will not close as before when the reminders are all cleared. Have too manually close the window. Saw this was an issue many versions ago that seemed to be cleared after an update. I could find no way to "fix" the issue. Is this a new bug?

title: Timeout on contact with imap.gmail.com
content:
Asking for a friend. His account @gmail.com stopped working few days ago. (timeout on imap.gmail.com) This gmail-account keeps on working fine on outlook on same machine.

During creating new account, first steps are ok, but when it tries to connect to imap.gmail.com it fails after long time (assume to be timeout) I installed my gmail-account as a test: same issues. Timeout on connection with imap.gmail.com

Any clue? I am at end of options
creator: info2654

title: How to Roll Back Update by One or a Few Versions?
content:
I updated to 115.10.1 a few days ago and would like to roll back to what I had before.

Is there a way to do that?

And is there a file that has the version number in it? I would like to look in a system backup to find out the version number that I had last week.
creator: Toolworker

title: How can I pick the default 'from' address when starting a new email while browsing a saved search?
content:
Normally when you starting to write a new email, Thunderbird will set the 'from' address to the address of the account whose mailbox you're current browsing.

However, I have a saved search that entirely contains email from my secondary (work) account, but if I start a new email while browsing it, it picks my default (home) email address. This has caused me to accidentally send emails from the wrong address more than once!

Is there any way to change it so that it'll set the 'from' field of new emails to my work email when browsing that specific saved search?
creator: brian79

title: Google calendar not syncing to Thunderbird Lightning
content: Computer crashed. After restoring, Google calendar is not syncing. No error message that I can see. I unsubscribed and resubscribed to no avail. I have no clue what to look for and searching here is not helping as all the references to this are years old. Can someone help me figure out why this is happening?
